main event: Witnesses in Montevideo, Uruguay observed a fireball in the sky in 1972.
interesting points: The object was described as a fireball, which is a meteor of unusual size and brilliance.
Fireballs can display a range of colors during flight, including white, blue, green, orange, red, yellow, pink, and purple.
Fireballs are a rare occurrence, and it is unusual for an individual to see more than one or two in a lifetime.
The fact that a missile operation was in progress for the observer accounts for them starting the report.
The limited information in the report made the case unexplainable, but the conclusion was that the witnesses observed a fireball.
photographs: No photographs included in the report
